data.title: Been coming here for years, always good
data.text:
Yup, tucked away on a little alley is this gem of an old fashioned family diner. If you come on the weekends, expect a wait. But it is worth it.

One of my favorites is the red delicious omlette. Don't let it scare you away, chunks of apples and lots of cheddar make it great.

Always friendly staff, good coffee, good portions of every offering.

Perfect for a local no frills breakfast.

data.title: Small place, good food.
data.text: When you arrive at the entrance you write your name and the number in your part on the white board, you also identify if you want to sit outside or inside. We waited for 15 minutes before anyone came out to look at the board and we wanted outside and there were tables available. So that process can be improved. The food was very good, my husband loved the biscuits and gravy! The staff was friendly!

data.title: HIdden Away but Excellent Food
data.text: This is definitely a hidden gem.  It's small and very popular so don't be surprised if you have to wait to be seated.  The staff is very friendly and the food is excellent.  Worth the wait.

data.title: Back alley gem
data.text: Small cafe hidden in a Vista alley. Centrally located. Good food & an assortment of foods. Counter service, tables & chairs plus some seating outside. Creat service w/ friendly staff. Reasonable prices.

data.title: Good ol'e American diner
data.text: Family run, nothing fancy on the menu.  Always welcome with a smile and an extra cup of coffee.  Sit at the counter and say hello to the regulars.  Great local "joint" that has a lengthy history - meals are just what your mom served you in 1968.  PS - my son's favorite hash browns in the region!

data.title: Great Food
data.text: I've been going to Allen's Alley for many years and they never disappoint. Great food and great service.

data.title: BREAKFAST
data.text: This is an excellent family owned business with great food and service.  You will not be disappointed on whatever ffod choice you make.

data.title: Gravy Benedict
data.text: Visited this little gem in downtown vista recently and I liked the interior setting of this place. Not very big but definitely that old style local dive. May seem a little run down but I like that comfortable feel. Staff was great. They were fun and wonderful to interact with. Always on top of refills. I had the Southern Benedict with sausage gravy. It was pretty good just wish it had more chunks of sausage in the gravy. Home potatoes were simple and flavorful. Will definitely go to try other gravy enticing meals and will take folks there for sure.

data.title: A very good place for breakfast.
data.text: We (4 adults) chose this restaurant due to the good local reviews and agree with their ratings.  It is a very small dining room, so limited seating,  The staff was very nice and the food was good.  They even allowed us to sample their biscuits and gravy dish, which is there specialty.  Will definitely go back.

data.title: Somewhat over-rated
data.text: This place's specialty is bisuits and gravy. Old-time customers rave about it. Don't waste your time ... it's insipid. If you want good biscuits and gravy, go to the Vista Way Cafe on East Vista Way. In all fairness, the rest of Allen's Alley menu is pretty decent, but not worth waiting in line for.

data.title: Good Eats at Allan's Alley
data.text: What can I say the best hole in the wall breakfast place in all of Vista! whether you sitting at the counter or dining inside or out side the service is always great and the food is fantastic!

data.title: eating at Ma's
data.text: great food and atmosphere.  Olden time decor and friendly waitresses.  I felt like I was in a diner from the fifties.

data.title: "Looking for a change"
data.text:
We went with big appetites , and at the wrong time because the placed was packed, it's a very small outdated older place. 
Since there wasn't many seating options we took first seat available , we were outside next to the back door entrance to the kitchen and also straight across from a garbage can. 
The service is exceptional good, the waitress was very attentive and knows the menu good she had many recommendations for breakfast. The portions are very fair, however the food lacked taste. I ordered steak and eggs my friend ordered huevos rancheros , steak wasn't tasty and a somewhat tuff, the huevos rancheros sauce was too thick we both decided thanks but no thanks we will pass on coming back again.
So I would say this if your looking for good service, and you don't mind sharing your food with flys if your dining outside, but the  portions are large then this is a good spot.

I do want to add the customers seemed to be regulars and seemed to
 to be enjoying the food and atmosphere  the flower shop next door was in the process of painting a wall mural which was the conversation piece while we were there.

But if your like me and you want it all, good quality and quantity, service and a clean environment then you just may want to skip this place.

data.title: Old faithful!!
data.text: We have been coming to Allen's Alley for years now, and they have never once disappointed us!  Great food, generous portions, fair prices, and the friendly casual staff keep us coming back!  Truly the yummy hole in the wall neighborhood restaurant - we wouldn't change a thing!!

data.title: This is one of our Favorite Weekend Brunch spots
data.text:
My wife and I love this place!  For a while we were going every weekend, I think we even went a consecutive Saturday/Sunday once.  What we love about it: It's family owned, run by super nice people, the waitresses are all great and the food is always served hot.
The Biscuits and Gravy is what keeps my wife coming back.  There are not many places to get breakfast around here that make good Biscuits and serve the gravy HOT.
The "Everything But the Kitchen Sink" omelette is my favorite.  Stay away from the Machaca though... it's just bad, and I love me some Machaca!
Hash Browns, excellent (especially Extra Crispy).  Home Fries, also excellent.  LOTS of coffee refills, Check.
We like to sit right next to the cook, in the back near the bathroom.  That way the food is EXTRA HOT :)
Come try it.  You'll like it.

data.title: Family eatery
data.text: Small family owned restaurant for breakfast & lunch. Excellent food with a local atmosphere. Great family place.

data.title: THE breakfast place
data.text: This is a great place for breakfast.  Plenty to eat, old fashioned diner atmosphere.  Hearty food.  It's small, so there is not a lot of seating. If you're hungry, plan ahead

data.title: Allen's Breakfast is worth waking up for
data.text: Allen's is a great little spot tucked into the local downtown area of Vista just off of main street. Found this place and made it a common happening for breakfast. It's a location with a ton of history serving up great food for many locals that give the place its charm.

data.title: Incredible find
data.text: Probably in the top 3 biscuits and gravy I've had my life it was phenomenal just  melted in your mouth delicious hash browns very highly recommend this place

data.title: A Vista landmark
data.text: It may be small and somewhat hidden between Main and Broadway, but the food is very good and the prices are good. Their biscuits and gravy are some of the best we've had. Good selection on the menu-made fresh.
